result.execSummary:
The defendant Sean J. Mueller was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Manufacture/Deliver Heroin (<3g), a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(d)1.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
THE DEPARTMENT OF CORRECTIONS SHALL DEDUCT RESTITUTION AND ALL OTHER COURT OBLIGATIONS AT THE RATE OF 25% OF ALL MONIES RECEIVED WHILE INCARCERATED.
Concurrent with: Concurrent with sentence in file 2014CF000243.

superMiscConds.notes:
Pay court costs and Department of Corrections Supervision Fees.  If the defendant is discharged from Extended Supervision with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment may be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.
-----------------------------

No alcohol or illegal drugs. No contact with Michael Miller or Lucas Smillie. No contact with the victim.
-----------------------------

Pay restitution as ordered in file 2014CF000243.  Provide biological specimen to state crime lab for DNA analysis, and pay DNA analysis surcharge.
-----------------------------
Attend AODA counseling or other programming as directed by Agent.

Signed bond filed with the court.
Not guilty plea and trial reserved.

Bond must be co-signed by Paula Mueller. TOTAL BOND: 14CF243, 14CF270, 14CT189, 14CT190 AND 14CT191. DEFENDANT TO BE RELEASED TO CUSTODY OF HIS MOTHER - NOT TO LEAVE HIS HOME WITHOUT SUPERVISION UNLESS GOING TO WORK OR TREATMENT.   Defendant shall not possess or consume alcohol.  Defendant shall not drive a motor vehicle without a valid driver's license.  Defendant shall not possess or use illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia.    Defendant will not in any way contact or attempt to contact any victim(s) listed and will avoid their residence/place of employment or any place they are located and will avoid causing any other person, other than defendant's attorney, from doing so on defendant's behalf.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as through the mail, by telephone, by way of electronic device, in person, or through a third party.  VICTIM(S)/RESIDENCE(S): NO CONTACT WITH J.D. NO CONTACT WITH CO-ACTORS LUCAS SMILLIE OR MICHAEL MILLER. NO CONTACT WITH WITNESSES S.S. OR L.C. Defendant shall personally ensure that payments are made under any Order for Income Withholding if the Court appoints an attorney for the defendant.

Defendant Sean J. Mueller in court, in custody with attorney Julia M May.  Valerian A Powell appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Minutes filed. Information filed. Not guilty plea entered. Speedy trial waived.  Status conference scheduled for July 17, 2014 at 01:15 pm.
